meanings.definition: The act of canceling something before it is officially scheduled to occur.
meanings.sent1: The precancellation of the event saved us from wasting time and resources.
meanings.sent2: She requested precancellation of her flight booking due to a sudden change in plans.
meanings.sent3: The precancellation of the party left everyone surprised but relieved.
meanings.sent4: His decision to precancel the meeting was a proactive move to avoid conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The precancellation notice came just in time to prevent any inconvenience.

meanings.definition: A stamp that has been canceled before being affixed to mail.
meanings.sent1: He collected rare precancellations as a hobby.
meanings.sent2: The philatelist carefully examined the precancellation on the stamp.
meanings.sent3: The post office mistakenly used a precancellation on all the letters.
meanings.sent4: The precancellation on the stamp made it unique among the collection.
meanings.sent5: The precancellation mark indicated the stamp's authenticity and history.

meanings.definition: The process of canceling an order or subscription before it is fulfilled.
meanings.sent1: The company allows precancellation of subscriptions within a specific period.
meanings.sent2: She regretted not opting for precancellation when she changed her mind.
meanings.sent3: His habit of precancellation for online purchases saved him from impulsive buys.
meanings.sent4: The option for precancellation provided customers with flexibility and peace of mind.
meanings.sent5: The policy of precancellation helped prevent unnecessary charges for unused services.
